test.name: Start Browser And Go To Southwest

Open Browser And Set Selenium Speed

kw.doc: Sets the delay that is waited after each Selenium command.

kw.doc: Returns the value attribute of element identified by ``locator``.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Numbers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to real numbers.

kw.name: Calculate Datepicker Counts And Get Formatted Values
Get Current Date
kw.doc: Returns current local or UTC time with an optional increment.

kw.name: Date Diff Months To Shift
kw.doc: Simple function to take 2 dates (depart and return) in the format %m/%d/%Y and calculate the number of shift forward on the calendar picker. For example, given departure 05/23/2019 return 06/10/2019 this function will return 0 We return the difference -1 because Southwest's calendar picker shows 2 months at a time.

kw.name: Set Suite Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Date Diff Months To Shift
kw.doc: Simple function to take 2 dates (depart and return) in the format %m/%d/%Y and calculate the number of shift forward on the calendar picker. For example, given departure 05/23/2019 return 06/10/2019 this function will return 0 We return the difference -1 because Southwest's calendar picker shows 2 months at a time.

kw.name: Set Suite Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Format My Date
kw.doc: Simple function to take a date in the format %m/%d/%Y and convert it to a format that is used on Southwest's calendar picker. For example, given date 05/23/2019 return may-23 This is required to make sure that we pick the correct date on the date picker for departure and return date.

kw.name: Set Suite Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.

kw.name: Format My Date
kw.doc: Simple function to take a date in the format %m/%d/%Y and convert it to a format that is used on Southwest's calendar picker. For example, given date 05/23/2019 return may-23 This is required to make sure that we pick the correct date on the date picker for departure and return date.

test.doc: Here we are doing the validation for the results page. We are making sure the first and return flight information is correct. Because Southwest has so many different date formats that they use on various pages, I did not parameterize this validation. Though I would in a real scenario if I was writing more tests like this. See "Validate Departure And Arrival Dates On Trip And Price Details Page" where something was done to validate another date format that Southwest uses.

kw.name: Validate Departure And Arrival Dates On Trip And Price Details Page
Date With Day Of Week Appended
kw.doc: Simple function to take a date in the format %m/%d/%Y and return a shortened version with the last 2 digits of the year along with the day of the week. For example, given departure 05/23/2019 return 5/23/19 Thursday This is used to validate any date printed on Southwest's page in the format like 5/23/19 Thursday.

kw.name: Date With Day Of Week Appended
kw.doc: Simple function to take a date in the format %m/%d/%Y and return a shortened version with the last 2 digits of the year along with the day of the week. For example, given departure 05/23/2019 return 5/23/19 Thursday This is used to validate any date printed on Southwest's page in the format like 5/23/19 Thursday.

kw.name: Close All Browsers
kw.doc: Closes all open browsers and resets the browser cache.

suite.doc: This is a suite of tests to verify the scenarios given in the takehome assignment. Mainly testing the positive scenario of booking a roundtrip flight and validating at each step. We are testing features in the following pages: - Southwest flight homepage - Southwest flight search results page - Southwest trip and price details page
